episodeTitle: Enter God Eneru! Farewell to the Survivors!
description: Usopp witnesses a mysterious figure repairing the Going Merry, which is found fully restored by morning. Enel appears before his priests and removes their limitations, declaring a survival game. The Straw Hats split into two teams: one to retrieve the gold and another to sail the ship to safety.

events.title: Klabautermann First Appearance
events.description: Usopp witnesses a mysterious small figure wearing a sailor's raincoat and carrying a wooden hammer repairing the heavily damaged Going Merry during the night. Shocked and frightened, Usopp blacks out from fear.
events.significance: First appearance of the Going Merry's ship spirit, the Klabautermann, revealing that the ship has developed a spiritual manifestation born from the crew's love and care. This moment foreshadows the ship's eventual fate and establishes the deep bond between the crew and their vessel.

quotes.text: It would strive to sail the crew farther for a little while longer.
quotes.speaker: Klabautermann
quotes.context: The ship spirit's promise to Usopp about continuing to serve the crew

events.title: Going Merry Mysteriously Repaired
events.description: The crew discovers that the Going Merry, which had been severely damaged by Shura's fire attack, has been completely restored to its original pristine condition overnight. Zoro finds Usopp unconscious near the ship.
events.significance: Demonstrates the Klabautermann's power and devotion to the crew. This mysterious repair allows the Straw Hats to continue their journey and establishes the supernatural bond between a well-loved ship and its crew.

events.title: Enel Appears Before the Priests
events.description: Enel, the self-proclaimed God of Skypiea, makes his formal appearance before his four priests: Ohm, Gedatsu, Shura, and Satori. Rather than greeting them formally, he casually attacks them with his lightning powers out of boredom, demonstrating his overwhelming strength and tyrannical nature.
events.significance: Establishes Enel as the primary antagonist of the Skypiea Arc and demonstrates his terrifying power and capricious personality. This scene shows the priests' fear and subservience to their god.

events.title: Yama Debuts
events.description: Yama, the commander of the Divine Soldiers and a massive Birkan standing 366 cm tall, appears alongside Enel. He serves as one of Enel's enforcers during the survival game.
events.significance: Introduces a new antagonist who will later confront the Straw Hats. Yama represents Enel's military force on Skypiea.

events.title: Enel Removes Priests' Limitations
events.description: Enel announces that he is removing all the limitations and restrictions he had previously placed on his priests, giving them unlimited power in their hunt for the Straw Hat Pirates and the Shandia warriors.
events.significance: Escalates the danger level for the Straw Hats significantly. The priests are now free to use their full abilities without restraint, making the survival game far more deadly.

events.title: Enel Announces the Survival Game
events.description: Enel declares a survival game where the Straw Hat Pirates and Shandia warriors will battle his forces. He proclaims that only five people will survive this ordeal: himself and four others. He mentions his nearly-complete Ark Maxim and his plans for a 'dream world'.
events.significance: Sets up the climactic conflict of the Skypiea Arc and reveals Enel's larger plans beyond just ruling Skypiea. The survival game becomes the framework for the upcoming battles.

quotes.text: Only five people will survive: myself and four others.
quotes.speaker: Enel
quotes.context: Enel declaring the rules of his survival game

events.title: Nami Divides the Crew
events.description: Nami organizes the Straw Hats into two strategic teams. The Exploration Team (Luffy, Zoro, Robin, and Chopper) will head to the ancient ruin's skull to retrieve the gold. The Ship Team (Nami, Usopp, and Sanji) will navigate the Going Merry to position it for escape.
events.significance: Demonstrates Nami's strategic thinking and leadership. This division allows the crew to pursue their objective while maintaining an escape route, though it also splits their combat strength.

events.title: Usopp Uses Chopper as Bait
events.description: To retrieve the Going Merry from the sacrificial altar, Usopp devises a plan to use Chopper as bait to lure sky sharks. The plan works, allowing them to harness the sharks' power to move the ship.
events.significance: A comedic moment showcasing Usopp's creative problem-solving and Chopper's brave (if reluctant) cooperation. This scene highlights the crew's ingenuity and teamwork in overcoming obstacles.

events.title: Going Merry Pulled from the Altar
events.description: Using the sky sharks' strength, the crew successfully pulls the Going Merry off the sacrificial altar and begins moving it toward the southern part of Upper Yard, where the two teams will reunite after retrieving the gold.
events.significance: The crew regains mobility and control of their ship, setting up their escape plan. This marks the beginning of the final phase of their Skypiea adventure.

events.title: Ark Maxim Mentioned
events.description: Enel mentions his nearly-complete Ark Maxim, a mysterious ship that is part of his plan to reach a 'dream world.' The priests acknowledge the ark's importance to Enel's ultimate goal.
events.significance: Foreshadows Enel's true objective and the existence of a powerful ancient technology. The Ark Maxim will become crucial to the arc's climax and Enel's defeat.

quotes.text: It would strive to sail the crew farther for a little while longer.
quotes.speaker: Klabautermann
quotes.context: The ship spirit's promise to Usopp

quotes.text: Only five people will survive: myself and four others.
quotes.speaker: Enel
quotes.context: Declaring the rules of the survival game

themes.description: The episode beautifully illustrates how the crew's love and care for the Going Merry has given birth to its spirit, the Klabautermann. Their deep bond with the ship manifests as a tangible force that repairs and sustains it.
themes.symbolism: The Klabautermann represents the soul of the ship, born from the crew's devotion. The small child-like figure in a sailor's coat symbolizes innocence and dedication.
culturalReferences: Klabautermann is based on Germanic/nautical folklore about ship spirits that appear to sailors

themes.description: Enel's casual cruelty toward his priests and his declaration of a survival game demonstrate his tyrannical nature. His god complex and willingness to sacrifice lives for his amusement contrasts sharply with the Straw Hats' values of freedom and camaraderie.
themes.symbolism: Enel's lightning represents absolute power and divine judgment, while his treatment of subordinates shows the corruption of absolute authority.

themes.description: The Straw Hats demonstrate their growth as a crew through strategic planning. Nami's division of the team shows tactical thinking, while the creative use of sky sharks to move the ship highlights their adaptability.
themes.symbolism: The division into two teams represents the balance between offense and defense, ambition and caution.

characterSpotlights.development: Usopp witnesses the Klabautermann for the first time, a profound moment that will later become significant. He also demonstrates creativity by using Chopper as bait, though this highlights his tendency to involve others in his risky plans.
keyActions: Witnesses the Klabautermann repairing the Going Merry
Blacks out from fear upon seeing the ship spirit
Devises the plan to use Chopper as bait for sky sharks

characterSpotlights.development: Enel is fully introduced as the tyrannical God of Skypiea. His casual cruelty, overwhelming power, and grand ambitions are all on display. We learn about his survival game and his mysterious Ark Maxim project.
keyActions: Attacks his own priests out of boredom
Removes all limitations on the priests
Announces the survival game with only five survivors
Reveals his plans for the Ark Maxim and a 'dream world'
quotes: Only five people will survive: myself and four others.

characterSpotlights.development: Nami demonstrates her leadership and tactical abilities by dividing the crew into two effective teams, balancing the need to pursue treasure with the necessity of securing their escape.
keyActions: Divides the crew into Exploration Team and Ship Team
Plans the rendezvous point at the southern part of Upper Yard

characterSpotlights.development: The Klabautermann makes its first appearance, revealing itself as the spiritual manifestation of the Going Merry. It repairs the ship and promises to carry the crew for a while longer, establishing its role as a guardian and symbol of the crew's bond with their vessel.
keyActions: Appears to Usopp during the night
Makes a promise to continue sailing with the crew
quotes: It would strive to sail the crew farther for a little while longer.

mangaDifferences.difference: Episode 167 adapts Chapter 254 (pages 3-19). The anime extends some scenes for pacing and adds more detail to the ship repair discovery.

trivia.fact: This was the final episode of the Funimation-edited dub to air on U.S. television. The rest of the Skypiea Arc episodes aired only in Australia before the series returned to U.S. airwaves with later arcs.

The Klabautermann is based on real nautical folklore. In Germanic maritime tradition, the Klabautermann is a kobold (sprite) that lives on ships and helps sailors, appearing only to doomed ships or as a warning.
Yama's height of 366 cm (12 feet) makes him one of the tallest non-giant human characters introduced up to this point in the series.

The episode's Japanese title 'Kami Eneru Toujou!! Ikinokori e no Yoake Kyoku' translates to 'God Enel Appears!! Aubade to the Survivors!' An aubade is a poem or song about lovers separating at dawn, symbolizing the dawn of the survival game.
